member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xlink.XlinkNode
member.summary: An implementation for an XML node that supports XLink.

remarks.para: Xlink is dependent upon XML, and, for Gepsio, XLink will use the XML interfaces. The XLinkNode class itself does not need to be interface based, because its implementation will not need to change between platforms. It will simply leverage the lower-level XML service layer, which is interface based.
This class implements the specification available at http://www.w3.org/TR/xlink11/.

member.name: P:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.PresentableFactTree.TopLevelNodes
member.summary: A collection of top-level nodes in the tree.
member.remarks: This property is a list of top-level presentable tree nodes, each of which is represented by a class called . Unlike traditional trees in computer science, which have a single "root" node at the top, presentation linkbases do not necessarily define a single "root" top level node. Gepsio, therefore, must prepare for the scenario in which the presentation linkbase has multiple "top-level" nodes and defines a list of top level nodes in a presentable fact tree.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.ISchemaAttribute
member.summary: An interface to a specific XML implementation.

remarks.para: This interface provides an abstraction to the actual XML service layer used by Gepsio. Different XML service layers may be used: the .NET 3.5 implementation may use the System.Xml classes, while a Portable Class Library implementation may use LINQ-to-XML. This interface abstracts away the XML implementation specifics so that the rest of Gepsio can use a standard interface to the XML service layer without knowledge of a specific implementation.
The class provides a simple container mechanism for resolving interface types into a specific implementation.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xsd.AnySimpleType
member.summary: An encapsulation of the XML schema type "anySimpleType" as defined in the http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema namespace.

remarks.para: This class should be considered deprecated and will most likely be removed in a future version of Gepsio. In early CTPs, Gepsio implemented its own XML schema parser, and this class was created for the implementation of the XML schema parser type system. In later CTPs, Gepsio levergaed the XML schema support already available in the .NET Framework, which rendered Gepsio's XML schema type system obsolete.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.CalculationArc
member.summary: An encapsulation of the XBRL element "calculationArc" as defined in the http://www.xbrl.org/2003/linkbase namespace.

remarks.para: The CalculationArc manages information stored in a calculation arc. Calculation arcs are found in calculation linkbase documents. Calculation arcs take the following form:

para.code: <calculationArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/summation-item" xlink:from="FromLocatorLabel" xlink:to="ToLocatorLabel" order="[OrderValue]" weight="[WeightValue]" use="[UseValue]" />

remarks.para: It is important to note that the "to" label in a calculation arc may reference more than one locator. The 397.00 test in the XBRL-CONF-CR3-2007-03-05 conformance suite uses the following calculation link in 397-ABC-calculation.xml:

para.code: <calculationLink xlink:type="extended" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/link"> <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="397-ABC.xsd#A" xlink:label="summationItem" /> <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="397-ABC.xsd#B" xlink:label="contributingItem" /> <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="397-ABC.xsd#C" xlink:label="contributingItem" /> <!-- A = B + C --> <calculationArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/summation-item" xlink:from="summationItem" xlink:to="contributingItem" weight="1"/> </calculationLink>

remarks.para: Note that the calculation arc goes from a label of "summationItem" to a label of "contributingItem". Note also that there are two locators that match the "contributingItem" label: the locator with an href of "397-ABC.xsd#B" and a label with an href of "397-ABC.xsd#C". Both locators must be used for any calculations performed in satisfcation of the calculation arc.

remarks.para: This class should be considered deprecated and will most likely be removed in a future version of Gepsio. In early CTPs, Gepsio implemented its own XML schema parser, and this class was created for the implementation of the XML schema parser type system. In later CTPs, Gepsio levergaed the XML schema support already available in the .NET Framework, which rendered Gepsio's XML schema type system obsolete.

member.summary: The role of this definition arc.

remarks.para: A definition arc role is defined in XBRL markup through a "definitionArc" element attribute named "arcrole". The value of the "arcrole" attribute, if it exists, should reference a namespace that identifies the role.
If the "arcrole" attribute is not found in the "definitionArc" element, or if the value of the "arcrole" attribute is not one of the defined values, then the Role will be set to .

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xsd.GregorianDay
member.summary: An encapsulation of the XML schema type "gregorianDay" as defined in the http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema namespace.

remarks.para: This class should be considered deprecated and will most likely be removed in a future version of Gepsio. In early CTPs, Gepsio implemented its own XML schema parser, and this class was created for the implementation of the XML schema parser type system. In later CTPs, Gepsio levergaed the XML schema support already available in the .NET Framework, which rendered Gepsio's XML schema type system obsolete.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Item.ParseValueIntoComponentParts

summary.para: Parses the fact value into three main parts:

list.item: Values to the left of the decimal point
Values to the right of the decimal point

member.para: Some of these values may be empty if the original value did not carry all of these components.
member.returns: A string array of length 3. Item 0 contains the value before the decimal point, item 1 contains the value after the decimal point, and item 2 contains the exponent value. If any of these elements are not available in the original value, then their individual value within the array will be empty.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Item.ParseValueIntoComponentParts(System.String)

summary.para: Parses a string representation of a fact value into three main parts:

list.item: Values to the left of the decimal point
Values to the right of the decimal point

member.para: Some of these values may be empty if the original value did not carry all of these components.
member.returns: A string array of length 3. Item 0 contains the value before the decimal point, item 1 contains the value after the decimal point, and item 2 contains the exponent value. If any of these elements are not available in the original value, then their individual value within the array will be empty.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xsd.LengthFacet
member.summary: An encapsulation of the XML schema facet "length" as defined in the http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema namespace.

remarks.para: This class should be considered deprecated and will most likely be removed in a future version of Gepsio. In early CTPs, Gepsio implemented its own XML schema parser, and this class was created for the implementation of the XML schema parser type system. In later CTPs, Gepsio levergaed the XML schema support already available in the .NET Framework, which rendered Gepsio's XML schema type system obsolete.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Locator
member.summary: An encapsulation of the locator functionality as defined in the http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink namespace.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Locator.HrefEquals(System.String)
member.summary: Compares a supplied href references with the href stored in the Locator.
member.remarks: This method describes a match on the href portion of the locator, not the ID portion.
member.param: The hyperlink reference to compare against the locator.
member.returns: Returns true if the supplied href references the same location as the href stored in the Locator, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Locator.HrefDocumentUri
member.summary: The document URI for the locator's hyperlink reference.

remarks.para: Hyperlink references for locators may be specified with a fragment identifier, which has the form "url#id". If the locator's hyperlink reference includes a fragment identifier, then the document URI will contain the URL portion of the hyperlink reference. If the locator's hyperlink reference does not include a fragment identifier, then the document URI will match the hyperlink reference.

member.name: P:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Locator.HrefResourceId
member.summary: The resource ID for the locator's hyperlink reference.

remarks.para: Hyperlink references for locators may be specified with a fragment identifier, which has the form "url#id". If the locator's hyperlink reference includes a fragment identifier, then the resource ID will specify the identifer. If the locator's hyperlink reference does not include a fragment identifier, then the resource ID will be empty.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xsd.WhiteSpaceFacet
member.summary: An encapsulation of the XML schema facet "whiteSpace" as defined in the http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema namespace.

remarks.para: This class should be considered deprecated and will most likely be removed in a future version of Gepsio. In early CTPs, Gepsio implemented its own XML schema parser, and this class was created for the implementation of the XML schema parser type system. In later CTPs, Gepsio levergaed the XML schema support already available in the .NET Framework, which rendered Gepsio's XML schema type system obsolete.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.XbrlDocument
member.summary: An XML document containing one or more XBRL fragments.

remarks.para: An XBRL fragment is a fragment of XBRL data having an xbrl tag as its root. In the generic case, an XBRL document will have an xbrl tag as the root tag of the XML document, and, in this case, the entire XBRL document is one large XBRL fragment. However, section 4.1 of the XBRL 2.1 Specification makes provisions for multiple XBRL fragments to be stored in a single document:
"If multiple 'data islands' of XBRL mark-up are included in a larger document, the xbrl element is the container for each [fragment]."
Gepsio supports this notion by defining an XBRL document containing a collection of one or more XBRL fragments, as in the following code sample:

In the vast majority of cases, an XBRL document will be an XML document with the xbrl tag at its root, and, as a result, the uses to load the XBRL document will have a single in the document's fragments container. Consider, however, the possibility of having more than one fragment in a document, in accordance of the text in section 4.1 of the XBRL 2.1 Specification.

member.summary: The constructor for the XbrlDocument class.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.XbrlDocument.Load(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads an XBRL document containing XBRL data from a stream.

remarks.para: Gepsio supports streams using the .NET Stream base class, which means that any type of stream supported by .NET and having the Stream class as a base class will be supported by Gepsio. This means that code like this will work:
Schema references found in streamed XBRL instances must specify an absolute location, and not a relative location. For example, this schema reference is fine:
However, this one is not:

The reason behind this restriction is that Gepsio must load schema references using an absolute location, and uses the location of the XBRL document instance as the reference path when resolving schema relative paths to an absolute location. A schema reference without a path, for example, says "find this schema in the same location as the XBRL document instance referencing the schema". When the XBRL document instance is located through a file path or URL, then the location is known, and the schema reference can be found. When the XBRL document instance is passed in as a stream, however, the instance has no location, per se. Since it has no location, there is no "location starting point" for resolving schema locations using relative paths.

If you try to load an XBRL document instance through a stream, and that stream references a schema through a relative path, then the document will be marked as invalid when the Load() method returns. This code, for example, will load an invalid document instance, since the XBRL document instance references a schema through a relative path:
The document's ValidationErrors collection will contain a SchemaValidationError object, which will contain a message similar to the following:
remarks.code: "The XBRL schema at msft-20141231.xsd could not be read because the file could not be found. Because the schema cannot be loaded, some validations will not be able to be performed. Other validation errors reported against this instance may stem from the fact that the schema cannot be loaded. More information on the "file not found" condition is available from the validation error object's inner exception property."
remarks.para: XBRL document instances loaded through a stream which use absolute paths for schema references will be valid (assuming that all of the other XBRL semantics in the instance are correct).

member.param: A stream of data containing the XML document to load.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.XbrlFragment.ValidateEssenceAliasedFacts(JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Item,JeffFerguson.Gepsio.FactCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Validate the essence alias between a given fact and all other facts with the given fact name.

remarks.para: An essence alias is a relationship between a "from" item and a "to" item. The "from" item and the "to" item must be identical. This method is given the "from" item and must search for the corresponding "to" item.

The scoping of the search for the corresponding "to" item is important. In the simple case, an XBRL fragment has only items, and the search for the corresponding "to" item can be conducted in the list all of all items in the fragment.

However, if the "from" item is found in a tuple, then the list of items from which the "to" item is to be found must be restricted to the other items in the tuple and not simply the set of all items in the fragment.

member.param: The item that represents the "from" end of the essence alias relationship.
The list of facts that should be searched to find the item that represents the "to" end of the essence alias relationship.
The name of the item that represents the "to" end of the essence alias relationship.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.IAttribute
member.summary: An interface to a specific XML implementation.

remarks.para: This interface provides an abstraction to the actual XML service layer used by Gepsio. Different XML service layers may be used: the .NET 3.5 implementation may use the System.Xml classes, while a Portable Class Library implementation may use LINQ-to-XML. This interface abstracts away the XML implementation specifics so that the rest of Gepsio can use a standard interface to the XML service layer without knowledge of a specific implementation.
The class provides a simple container mechanism for resolving interface types into a specific implementation.

member.name: T:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INode
member.summary: An interface to a specific XML implementation.

remarks.para: This interface provides an abstraction to the actual XML service layer used by Gepsio. Different XML service layers may be used: the .NET 3.5 implementation may use the System.Xml classes, while a Portable Class Library implementation may use LINQ-to-XML. This interface abstracts away the XML implementation specifics so that the rest of Gepsio can use a standard interface to the XML service layer without knowledge of a specific implementation.
The class provides a simple container mechanism for resolving interface types into a specific implementation.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INode.SelectNodes(System.String,JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INamespaceManager)
member.summary: Select a set of child nodes from the current nodes.
member.param: The XPATH specification of the nodes to be found.
The namespace manager to be used to resolve namespace information found in the given XPATH specification.
member.returns: A list of nodes in the document matching the given XPATH specification.

member.returns: The value of the attribute with the supplied name. The emprty string will be retrurned if no attribute is available with the given name.

The local name of the attribute whose value should be returned.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INode.StructureEquals(JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INode)
member.summary: Compare the node with another node, checking for structure-equals semantics.
member.remarks: Structure-equals is defined by the XBRL Specification as XML nodes that are either equal in the XML value space, or whose XBRL-relevant sub-elements and attributes are structure-equal.
member.param: A node to be compared with the current node.
member.returns: True if the node is structure-equals to another node; false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INode.ParentEquals(JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INode)
member.summary: Compare the node with another node, checking for parent-equals semantics.
member.remarks: Parent-equals is defined by the XBRL Specification as XML nodes having the same parent.
member.param: A node to be compared with the current node.
member.returns: True if the node is parent-equals to another node; false otherwise.

member.name: M:JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INodeList.StructureEquals(JeffFerguson.Gepsio.Xml.Interfaces.INodeList)
